fluid inside the nucleus surrounded by nuclear membrane is called nucleoplasm It controls the cell s growth and reproduction because it contains cell s hereditary information Protein is localized to the NucleoplasmNuclear Membrane 1 A nuclear membrane is a double membrane that encloses the cell nucleus It serves to separate the chromosomes from the rest of the cell The nuclear membrane includes an array of small holes or pores that permit the passage of certain materials such as nucleic acids and proteins between the nucleus and cytoplasmNucleoli 2 Nucleoli are small basophilic spherical bodies located in the nucleus Usually they can be found in the central nuclear region but may also be close to the nuclear membrane.
